title: “Selected” Exosomes from Sera of Elderly Severe Obstructive Sleep Apnea Patients: Their Impact on the Blood-Brain-Barrier Function
content: Background/Aims: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) affects a large part of the aging population. It is characterized by chronic intermittent hypoxia and associated with neurocognitive dysfunction. One hypothesis is that the blood-brain barrier (BBB) functions could be altered by exosomes. Exosomes are nanovesicles found in biological fluids. Through the study of exosomes and their content in tau and amyloid beta (AÔÅ¢), the aim of this study was to show how exosomes could be used as biomarkers of OSAS and of their cognitive disorders.
